net.realmproject.dcm.event.relay

Interface DeviceEventRelay

  • All Superinterfaces:
    DeviceEventNode
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractDeviceEventRelay, AbstractValueDevice, ActiveMQWireMessageSink, ActiveMQWireMessageSource, Camera, Device, ICommandDevice, IDeviceEventBus, IDeviceEventPublisher, IDeviceEventRelay, IValueDevice, IWireMessageSink, IWireMessageSource, JmsWireMessageSink, MjpegCamera, SpringWireMessageSource, UrlCamera

    public interface DeviceEventRelay
extends DeviceEventNode
    Interface for DCM event graph nodes which relay events to other nodes, either by being DeviceEventPublishers
    Author:
    NAS

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default boolean filter(DeviceEvent event)
      Method for filtering DeviceEvents using the specified filter
      boolean isSending()
      Is sending of events turned on?
      void setSending(boolean sending)
      Set if this component is currently sending events.
      default void startSending()
      If this component is not currently sending events, start sending them now.
      default void stopSending()

      • Methods inherited from interface net.realmproject.dcm.event.DeviceEventNode

        getFilter, getTransform, setFilter, setTransform, transform

    • Method Detail

      • filter

        default boolean filter(DeviceEvent event)
        Method for filtering DeviceEvents using the specified filter
        Specified by:
        filter in interface DeviceEventNode
        Parameters:
        event - the event to filter against
        Returns:
        true if the filter should pass the event, false if it should block it

      • isSending

        boolean isSending()
        Is sending of events turned on?
        Returns:
        true if this component is currently sending events, false otherwise

      • setSending

        void setSending(boolean sending)
        Set if this component is currently sending events. There is no backlog of unsent events retained. Events "sent" while this component was not sending are lost.
        Parameters:
        sending - whether to send events or not

      • startSending

        default void startSending()
        If this component is not currently sending events, start sending them now. There is no backlog of unsent events retained. Events "sent" while this component was not sending are lost.

      • stopSending

        default void stopSending()
        If this component is currently sending events, stop sending them now. There is no backlog of unsent events retained. Events "sent" while this component was not sending are lost.
